meanings.definition: The upper part of a boot or shoe that covers the instep.
meanings.sent1: She admired the intricate design on the vamps of her new boots.
meanings.sent2: The cobbler carefully stitched the vamps onto the leather shoes.
meanings.sent3: In the shoe store, the mischievous cat tried to play with the vamps of the display boots.
meanings.sent4: The vamps of the shoes hugged her feet like a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The shiny vamps gleamed under the bright lights of the stage.

meanings.definition: To improvise or ad lib music or speech.
meanings.sent1: During the performance, the singer vamps up the song with her unique style.
meanings.sent2: When the speaker forgot his lines, he had to vamp until he remembered.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to vamp about his morning mishaps to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent4: She had to vamp her way through the presentation when the slides didn't work.
meanings.sent5: The musician vamps a soulful melody on his guitar, captivating the listeners.

meanings.definition: A seductive woman who uses her charm to exploit men.
meanings.sent1: The movie portrayed the villain as a cunning vamp who manipulated the hero.
meanings.sent2: She played the role of a seductive vamp in the theater production.
meanings.sent3: The vamp at the party flirted shamelessly with every guest, causing a stir.
meanings.sent4: Her friend jokingly called her a vamp because of her persuasive ways.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious vamp in the novel lured the protagonist into a dangerous game.
